title: Atta Tarar grieved over demise of ‘autistic Palestinian’
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 18 (APP): Minister for Information, Broadcasting, Culture and National Heritage Attaullah Tarar on Thursday joined the global condemnation call made to disapprove demise of Mohammed Bhar, a 24-year-old Palestinian with Down syndrome and autism, by the injuries reportedly inflicted by “a combat dog of the Israel Defence Force (IDF)”.
According to the story, also shared by the minister on social media to grieve the demise of Bhar, said “Mohammed Bhar was left for dead after being mauled by a combat dog of the Israel Defence Force (IDF) on July 3, during a raid on his family’s home in Shejaiya.”
The minister, in his post that has Bhar’s picture, said, “He had Down syndrome and Autism. Their dogs attacked him and left him to die. At a loss of words, can’t explain the pain.”
He also prayed for the mercy of the Allah Almighty.
